description:
Coda started in 2014 with a simple observation: In a world full of pre-built tools and applications, why do documents and spreadsheets seem to run the world? The founding Coda team crossed paths at Google, YouTube, and Microsoft, where they saw their teams stretch the limits of what spreadsheets and documents can do. Then in 2014, they banded together to build the doc they always wanted. One that erased the boundaries between words and data. And where everyone could work together, in their own way, off the same data.

Coda. It's a new day for docs. Learn more at https://coda.io.
name: Coda
tagline: Coda is the all-in-one doc for teams. We're a growing startup looking to hire the next set of great Codans!

updates.text:
Get instant answers, from 500+ tools and all of your Coda docs.
Today, we’re partnering with Snowflake to launch Coda Brain, your team’s favorite know-it-all. It’s a turnkey AI platform that understands all your company’s knowledge and data by syncing all your tools into a comprehensive, up-to-date brain so you can spend less time hunting for information—and more time putting data to work.

Coda Brain is secure, inside and out. It’s fluent in words and data. It combats hallucinations with verifiable answers. And best of all, it’s connected to Coda docs.

Get an early look at Coda Brain: coda.io/brain

Turn your brainstorm into action—fast—in our new virtual event.

Ever start with a sea of sticky notes in Miro, only to feel stuck translating them into a project plan? With the Coda for Miro app, you can instantly turn your Miro brainstorming notes into structured Coda tables, creating the perfect launchpad for project tracking.

Join Rocky Moon, Coda’s Product Education Specialist, for a live walkthrough on:
✨ Taking your brainstorming from chaos to clarity
✨ Building a project tracker from your sticky notes
✨ Pro tips for working with tables in Coda

We’ll use a product launch example, but this workflow works for any project.

📅 Reserve your spot now: https://bit.ly/3APLZQU
🎥 Can’t make it live? Register to get the recording.

If you’ve worked with Coda or Miro, this session is for you.

Most planning starts out with brainstorming, but have you tried transforming these topics from sticky notes to action? It can be time-consuming and prone to error.

Join Rocky, Coda’s Product Education Specialist, as we walk through how to move from a brainstorming session to a structured table in Coda that forms the foundation of a project tracker.

https://bit.ly/4fMhU3I

Dates you can count on, no matter what country your team is in.

In Coda, you can now choose how dates and times are best displayed for your docs. Apply it to your current doc, or navigate to account settings to apply it for all new docs you create.

Arriving 1̶1̶/̶1̶3̶ 13/11.

1   Never miss another detail.
2   Line numbers make it easy
3  to track errors,
4   address specific points, and ensure
5   nothing is overlooked.
6
7   Ready to give it a spin? Hit the gear icon ⚙️
8   then select Page Options
9   to turn on line numbering for any doc.

You couldn't have asked for a better fall day in San Francisco.

A massive thank you to Lenny Rachitsky for hosting us and over 1,000 of his friends for the Lenny & Friends Summit. We're honored to not only have sponsored, but also help put on such an incredible experience.

From planning to building the conference app in a Coda doc (shout out Ben Lee and Rachel Ding), it was a great chance to show off all the amazing ways you can use Coda.

More to come, but for now, we rest.
